title: Unfair matchmaking

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body: I was the Irelia being ranked at s4 and playing vs a plat and golds I asked and neither of the teams were dynamic queue, our team got stomped so easily how is this even fair how does a s4 with less than 15 games played match up to platinums and golds with over 300 games played?

replies.body: It could simply be that your MMR was significantly higher than your rank while the plat players MMR was significantly lower than their rank, thus resulting in the two of you getting matched in a game together with a bunch of gold players.
That would make sense if their winrates weren't this good.

Taking a look at both players profiles on OP.GG, their (estimated) MMRs both match up with the possibility I suggested at the time of that match. Given that Lee Sinpai had gone on to lose 2 matches since and *still* have a higher than average MMR for their division, there's no possible way their MMR could've been less at the time the match was played. As for the "plat" player, their MMR is lower than average for their division, after a loss and a win since the shown match (which indicates their MMR would either be about the same or lower).
I'd like to know how our Prime Minister did as Vayne!
